title: China to import $8 trillion of goods in next 5 years: foreign minister
text:
March 30, 2018 / 11:46 AM / a few seconds ago China to import $8 trillion of goods in next five years: foreign minister Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BEIJING (Reuters) - China will import $8 billion of goods and attract $600 billion of foreign investment in the next five years, Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Friday. FILE PHOTO: Container boxes are seen at the Yangshan Deep Water Port, part of the Shanghai Free Trade Zone, in Shanghai, China September 24, 2016. Picture taken September 24, 2016. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo 
China’s overseas investment will reach $750 billion in the next five years, the foreign ministry said in a statement on its website, citing Wang at a conference in Vietnam. 
Wang said China would widen market access and open up its financial sector. 
The practices of unilateralism and protectionism would be a form of regression, and not only would they lead to a dead end, they would damage one’s own interests, he said. Reporting by Beijing monitoring desk
